results.title: The Giants
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Zdenka Deitchova and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: A satirical cartoon film which exposes and ridicules in allegorical form, human intolerance, malice, cowardice and irresponsibility. Intended as a protest against violence and despotism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Deitch, Zdenka Deitchova and Kratky Film

results.title: Giant molecules (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates addition and condensation polymerization reactions, and indicates how physical properties and molecular shape of polymers may be related. Four polymers are shown, and the differences in their properties are explained using models. Finally, materials are shown being turned into the more familiar plastic consumer goods.

results.title: Giant in the sun
results.creator_credit: Sidney Samuelson, Victor M. Gover and Northern Nigeria Information Services
results.brief_description: This film discusses the land and people of northern Nigeria. It covers the ancient cities of Kano, Sokoto, Ilorin and Katsina, with the dazzling spectacle of the Sallah, presided over by the Emir. Shows traditional crafts flourishing alongside modern developments in industry, education, health and welfare. (Award: Grand Award at the Third African Film Festival, 1959).

results.title: Ghana greets the Queen
results.brief_description: The vision and vigour of the Republic of Ghana provide backcloth to this account of the Royal tour in November 1961. Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and HRH Prince Philip were welcomed in Accra, where an exciting regatta and an inspection of Ghana’s armed forces and police were among engagements.

results.title: Ghan to Alice
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Follows two rodeo riders travelling from Moree to the Alice Springs Rodeo on the Ghan train. Includes shots of the country through which the Ghan passes and briefly looks at towns along the route. Commentary by Bill Willougby.

results.title: Geyser melodies
results.creator_credit: Guy Haselton and Guy O Hasleton Productions
results.brief_description: The world’s greatest display of geysers and hot springs in Yellowstone National Park in North America. Shown as being closely akin to nature’s most awesome spectacle - volcanoes. Designed to promote a better understanding of the earth’s beginnings and to show the artistry of nature in one of its most spectacular forms.

results.title: Getting yourself across
results.brief_description: Describes the art the speaker’s personality plays in getting ideas across to the audience. Shows how a speaker’s interest, preparation, sincerity, vitality, and confidence bring about a successful communication. Correlated with the book “General speech” by Baird and Knower.

results.title: Getting used to the water
results.brief_description: Some ways of getting beginners accustomed to the water. A class is seen first doing confidence exercises in then later, and learning the correct way to breath. The children then practise gliding, kicking, and lying on their back in the water. Some other exercises are demonstrated.

results.title: Getting through
results.brief_description: Examines the question of whether public health authorities are getting through the message of smoking’s dangers. Two major obstacles are that smoking has been socially acceptable for 400 years, and that the effects of smoking are so long delayed “you don’t know in the morning that young get lung cancer in the afternoon”. Consternates on Charlie, a typical teenage smoker and his girlfriend, Judy, with narration by Burt Lancaster.

results.title: Getting the message
results.brief_description: The mass media are being studied by scholars today more closely than ever before. Media study has been lagging behind but it is suggested that teaching at school level may help. This film shows what is being done in Tasmanian schools today with the critical study of news media and the study of film and television as an art form. It is one of the few states in Australia with a compulsory course in mass media as an examination subject in all secondary schools. The aim - to make students grow into discriminating adults.
